content:
Hola, Las versiones portables no son oficiales. El Thunderbird 127 era una versión Beta actualmente esta en la versión 128, pero según el calendario de release de Thunderbird la versión 127 no se lanzara como estable, en su lugar será la versión 128 ESR: https://blog.thunderbird.net/2024/06/may-2024-community-office-hours-the-thunderbird-release-process/

Si se ha resuelto la consulta agradeceríamos marcar como solucionada para que sirva a otros usuarios. ¡Gracias!
creator: pcp04

content: How is the crash behavior different from a freeze?
creator: wsmwk

content: If you have privacy or security concerns you can set Thunderbird to clear the cache on shutdown. But I would not advise turning it off.
creator: wsmwk

content: Forgot to add, I am able to login perfectly fine on macOS Sonova.

content: Issue resolved. A unknown system service was occupying port 80 and caused the auth flow to fail at the last step. Killing that service solved the issue.
creator: jamienibtong

content:
been shut out of my gmail account rosean3848@gmail.com as cannot remember password. help said they sent me a verification code but whole point is cannot get into this account.

Please help
creator: rosean3848@gmail.com

content: My suggestion is this - in the version you use, click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to profile folder', click 'open folder' - check to verify where the folder is. I presume it is at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird - exit thunderbird and copy the 'thunderbird folder else where for safety - DO THIS AFTER exiting thunderbird - now uninstall both version. if prompted to removed data, do NOT - now install the preferred version. it should start with the right profile. if not, exit thunderbird, and then copy the backup of the thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overlay what is there - start thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for the reply, David. I should have added to my original post that I store my Thunderbird emails on a different physical drive (D:), which is a regular hard drive, while the program itself (along with Windows and all my other programs) is stored on an SSD (C:). I set it up that way to make data backups easier since all data is on the hard drive (D:). I also wanted to reduce wear and tear on the SSD from constantly downloading emails to that drive.

What I didn't fully appreciate is that Thunderbird *really* seems to want my profile on the C: drive.

I have deleted both Thunderbird programs and installed the current version from the TB website. The problem I'm having now is trying to get TB to connect with my profile on the hard drive. When I set that profile as the default and try to use it, I get this pop-up:
creator: adlerkralle

content: To be a little more clear I am missing emails due to them being hidden in unexpanded previous threads. Only new emails that are not replies am I guaranteed to see

content: Enter the name of the mailing list in the To, Cc or Bcc box, then right-click, Expand List (see picture).

content:
Hello there We have read the question We try to help

We're sorry you forgot your password. When logging in to your account, you can normally click on the forgot password option to replace the password with a new one for u.Is this possible with you ? First, you will need to cooperate a few steps to obtain it and retrieve your saved questions to request them again or create an additional email account for verification or solve puzzles so that they know it is you and not another suspicious person requesting one for you.

Try to do this as well as possible and precisely. Please take a moment to do this both on your first e-mail account and your second e-mail account.

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird
